Detailed Description

Fourier Domain Preconditioner for Tomography step.

cfft2s(A,-1) and cfft2s(A,1) are hermitian ffts because they have the same scale.

Function Documentation

Create aperture selection function that selects the gradients for valid subapertures from ground layer xloc (or ploc).

long* fdpcg_perm ( const long *  nx,
const long *  ny,
const long *  os,
int  nps 
)

Create a permulation acting on xhat (fft of x on xloc) so that points of the same spatial frequency in all layers are grouped together.

In this implementation, it implies that all the screens have the same spatial sampling frequency, or they have the same tot spatial size.

The ray tracing couples the screens but only on points with same or harmonic spatial frequencies. Group them together.

void fdpcg_precond ( dcell **  xout,
const void *  A,
const dcell *  xin 
)

Apply the Fourier domain preconditioner.

Preconditioner solves xout=M^-1*xin where M is the preconditioner matrix. Here M^-1 is applied in Fourier Domain via xout=IFFT(M*FFT(xin));

void fdpcg_free ( FDPCG_T *  fdpcg  )
